thread.title: Cardinals' Ellington aiming for return vs Rams
thread.title_full: Cardinals' Ellington aiming for return vs Rams

author: The Sports Xchange
title: Cardinals' Ellington aiming for return vs Rams
text:
Cardinals' Ellington aiming for return vs Rams The Sports Xchange 40 mins ago The Sports Xchange Â© Getty Images ARLINGTON, TX - NOVEMBER 02: Andre Ellington #38 of the Arizona Cardinals stiff arms Jeff Heath #38 of the Dallas Cowboys at AT&T Stadium on November 2, 2014 in Arlington, Texas. The Cardinals defeated the Cowboys 28-17. (Photo by Wesley Hitt/Getty Images) Arizona Cardinals running back Andre Ellington has been termed a game-time decision for Sunday's game against the St. Louis Rams.
AdChoices Ellington sprained a posterior cruciate ligament in his right knee in the season opener and missed the past two games. He returned to practice earlier this week and was listed as questionable on Friday's injury report.
Arizona coach Bruce Arians indicated that Chris Johnson will start the game even if Ellington suits up.
"Andre's not full speed enough to be a starter," Arians told reporters.
Ellington said he will wear a brace on the knee and that he expects to play against the Rams.
"I don't see why not," he said. "I'm going to be smart about it."
